summary.p: This manuscript contains the first two kāṇḍas of the Amarakoṣa, a Sanskrit lexicon, with a commentary in mixed Tamil and Telugu. Each kāṇḍa is foliated separately. The title of the commentary, Amarakoṣapañcikā, is given in the catalogue entry of Antoine Cabaton, although it does not seem to appear in the manuscript itself. The title is probably carried over from Sanscrit 621 (old shelfmark a/6), a manuscript of the third kāṇḍa of the Amarakoṣa, with a Tamil commentary. However, that manuscript seems to be by a different scribe, and the commentary also seems to be different — it does not seem to have Telugu words mixed in.
For a different commentary on the Amarakoṣa in mixed Tamil and Telugu, see Ciotti & Sathyanarayan 2020.

collation.desc: First kāṇḍa: unnumbered satellite stanza folio, 1-146.
Second kāṇḍa: title folio numbered 1, first verse on an unnumbered folio, commentary begins 1-161.

supportDesc.condition: Good condition, albeit with some worm holes.

provenance.p: Likely part of the collection of Édouard Ariel.
